fact_check_explanation_title: Video of police officer egged by children is a prank
fact_check_explanation_summary: Viral videos on social media seemingly showing a police officer lying on the ground while children pelt him with eggs are not what they seem.

fact_check_explanation_title: We do not test 330,000 people a day for Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: The true number of people tested for Covid-19 each day, under the Test and Trace programme for England, is about 52,000

fact_check_explanation_title: Why this poll gives a misleading view on how many people the public think Covid-19 has killed
fact_check_explanation_summary: By using a mean average, the results overstated what the average Brit thinks the death rate has been.

fact_check_explanation_title: Universal Credit monthly allowance is more than House of Lords daily allowance – for now
fact_check_explanation_summary: Temporary increases to Universal Credit introduced because of the coronavirus pandemic mean the monthly allowance is now higher than the daily allowance for peers in the House of Lords.

fact_check_explanation_title: What are the quarantine rules if you return to the UK from abroad?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Our readers have asked us to explain the guidance around self-isolating if you have visited another country.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ordinary face masks are not harmful
fact_check_explanation_summary: Mask wearing is not harmful for most people, apart from rare instances involving tight-fitting N95 respirators.

fact_check_explanation_title: A baseless paper that linked skin cells, 5G and coronavirus has been retracted
fact_check_explanation_summary: The paper made claims about how 5G waves could be absorbed by skin cells and produce coronavirus but provided no credible evidence.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post on lockdown rule changes are right for certain parts of England
fact_check_explanation_summary: As of 31 July, the lockdown rules changed for people in Greater Manchester and parts of Lancashire and West Yorkshire.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral Facebook post incorrectly claims that a list of PPE contracts are all unfulfilled
fact_check_explanation_summary: PPE procurement is under scrutiny but claims that all these contracts were unfulfilled is not evidenced.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ian Huntley has not been found dead in his cell
fact_check_explanation_summary: The man who killed two girls in 2002 has not died, as a Facebook post claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: The BBC did not say that the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation is planning to put microchips in Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: The article in question is a speculative article on the future of travel and does not mention microchips.

fact_check_explanation_title: The evidence shows surgical masks do offer protection from Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral video claims surgical masks are “no good” as they don’t offer complete protection to the wearer. Evidence shows masks still have benefits.
